result.execSummary:
The defendant Spensor J. KNITTER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of a park (<3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to use one doctor to prescribe medications and one pharmacist to fill those medications unless otherwise approved by the agent.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA assessment and counseling.  (the court will accept the assessment already completed by Ms. Lawrenz).

records.addlTxt: Letter from Laurie Lawrenz at Labor of Love Counseling and Education Center.
Sentencing hearing is reset to 09-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Documents in Support.

Defendant is before the Court for sentencing having been convicted of delivery of heroin within 1,000 feet of a park.  
Counsel have reviewed the PSI report and defense counsel states there are several changes or clarifications that need to be made.  Discussion held.  
Sentencing hearing reset to 09-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.   
Documents in Support.

Order Granting Modificaiton of Conditions of Release
The defendant must personally report to the Two Rivers Police Department daily by 4:00 p.m., rather than 12:00 noon, as previously ordered; except that
The defendant must personally report to the Two Rivers Police Department before leaving for vacation on July 2, 2015, then must report by 4:00 p.m. on July 6, 2015 upon his return from same.   
Cover Letter.

Count 2 - Deliver Heroin within 1,000 feet of park - Guilty plea.  Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, deliver heroin and count 3, deliver heroin within 1,000 feet of park.  Motion granted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing is set for 09-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Report to be filed by 08-21-15.  Parties stipulate to amend defendant's daily reporting time to 4:00 p.m. and to excuse him from reporting on 07-03-15, 07-04-15, and 07-05-15 to attend vacation with his family.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Letter from Judge Rohrer to Attorney Misfeldt denying his motion for temporary bail modification.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Temporary Modification of Bail Conditions.
Cover letter.

Notice of Motion and Emergency Motion for Temporary Modification of Bail Conditions.
It is ordered that the defendant's motion is granted and the defendant does not need to report to the Two Rivers Police Department on March 14, 2015 and March 15, 2015, but must report daily thereafter as previously ordered.  The defendant will also maintain absolute sobriety and must also comply with all previous conditions of bond.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-12-14 at 10:15 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
At 9:57 a.m., search warrant for Apple iPhone with return of officer thereon.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 10-16-14 at 3:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  An Apple iPhone, silver and black, with FCC number BCG-E2642A, belonging to Spendor J. Knitter, DOB; 05-04-1993 and currently held at the Two Rivers Police Department.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts deliver heroin within 1000 feet of park and 1 count deliver heroin.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-06-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department daily by 12:00 p.m. and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
